text:
[Narrator] AWS Key Management
Service, or AWS KMS, allows you to

create and manage cryptographic
keys that protect data across
your AWS workloads.

Access is governed by the key
policy which lets you precisely

control when, how, and who can
read your data.

And using asymmetric key pairs,
you can create and verify

digital signatures to ensure
the integrity of your data.

Your keys are securely generated
and protected using FIPS

140-validated hardware security
modules, devices trusted

by government, financial,
and healthcare institutions.

Since AWS KMS is integrated
with AWS CloudTrail,

you're able to record all your
API requests including

key management action, key lifecycle
events and usage.

This helps you manage risks,
meet compliance requirements
or conduct forensic analysis.

AWS KMS is integrated
with over a hundred AWS services

including all major databases,
analytics, storage, and workflow
and productivity tools.

Because it's fully managed,
AWS KMS automatically

scales to meet your needs and
is designed to ensure your critical

workloads always have access
to your keys.

Improve your security and start
encrypting with AWS KMS.
